bio: We are Your Shot — @natgeo's photo community. Let's tell stories together. #YourShotPhotographer

list.comment:
An Icy Swim | Photograph by Magnus Heinmets
.
#YourShotPhotographer Magnus Heinmets used a drone to photograph himself fulfilling one of his biggest dreams: to visit Iceland and swim between icebergs. "Love the blue tones you were able to get in this image! Excellent use of drone photography!" commented Your Shot Senior Producer Matt Adams.
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod.

Amidst the Green | Photograph by R. M. Félix (@ruimiguelfelix)
.
#YourShotPhotographer R. M. Félix captures a praying mantis exploring some vegetation. "Always a surprise to discover a tiny creature moving amidst the green," he remarked.
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod.

Flamingo Season | Photograph by Teong Lin Ng (@nkteong)
.
Every year, Kenya's Lake Bogoria receives an influx of tourists between late August and early October. But the visitors aren't people—they're flamingos. Hundreds of thousands of lesser flamingos flock to the low waters of Lake Bogoria before the rainy season begins. During that period, the area is home to the largest flock of lesser flamingos in the world.
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod. #YourShotPhotographer

Top Shot: Serenity in the North Evia Gulf | Photograph by Dimitris Boulougouris (@deltami2110)
.
A lone boatman sits still at the North Evia Gulf. Your Shot Producer David Y. Lee writes, “This is so beautiful, I love how peaceful this scene is — the water is so still. I love the colors. Fantastic use of reflection to amplify how gorgeous this moment is.” This image was selected for the Daily Dozen on November 21, 2018.
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account. #YourShotPhotographer

Tender Moment | Photograph by Girish Londhe
.
A mother giraffe shares a tender moment with her calf in Kenya's Rift Valley. "The light on momma and child is so lovely… who can resist the patterns and shape of giraffes," commented #YourShotPhotographer Patricia Przybylinski.
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod.

Top Shot: Rhythm of the Sunrise | Photograph by Trung Pham (@phtrung0611)
.
#YourShotPhotographer Trung Pham captured this serene sunrise silhouetting palm trees in the Mekong Delta in Vietnam. Your Shot Producer David Y. Lee writes, "I love your use of reflection, the colors from the sunrise are gorgeous. I love Your Shot photographer Anne Oehlen’s comment: 'Such a beautiful rhythm of trees against that wonderful play of light. Great capture!’” This image was selected for the Daily Dozen on November 28, 2018.
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account.

Top Shot: Wintery August Days | Photograph by Christopher Markisz (@dubsonata)
.
“Coastal fog cascades over Bolinas Fairfax Ridge in West Marin County, California on a recent August afternoon,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Christopher Markisz. “Conditions like this are typical during summer months but can transform the landscape into something resembling a ski resort when photographed using long exposure techniques.”
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account

Top of the Täschhorn | Photograph by Ben Tibbetts (@bentibbettsphotography)
.
A climber stands atop the jagged peak of the Täschhorn in the Swiss Alps. #YourShotPhotographer Ben Tibbetts was in the same group that climbed the 14,734-foot tall mountain. "We set off under a fine starry sky," but before it even got light it started snowing... making for a long day out.
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod.

[ #TBT From November 15, 2017 ] Top Shot: Sunset Flight | Photograph by Phillip Chang
.
“This picture was taken from a helicopter over northern Tanzania’s Lake Natron,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Phillip Chang. “A flock of flamingos were flying over the lake against the last rays of the sun. Reflections of the blue sky and golden cloud made the lake the perfect background for the pink birds.”
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account.

Top Shot: Lizard in the Purple Patch | Photograph by Asher Thye (@ash.thye)
.
#YourShotPhotographer Asher Thye came across this little lizard jumping between Purple Heart plants, also known as Setcreasea pallida, outside his home. Asher writes, “Despite his bright green color, I’m surprised I saw him — he was no more than three inches in length. I was lucky to get this shot before a passing car scared him off into the bushes nearby!” This image was selected for the Daily Dozen on November 15, 2018.
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account.

Between the Lines | Photograph by Fran Llano
.
Mist surrounds the jagged edges of flysch on the Basque Coast in Spain. Flysch alternates thin and coarse layers of sediment, making for a dramatic landscape. But #YourShotPhotographer Fran Llano writes that the view is more than just aesthetic, it's informational. "Layer by layer," he says, "the rocks offer a unique vision of the geological features of this area, reading a rocky book full of information."
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod.

Sunrise Over the Spring | Photograph by Jassen Todorov (@jassensf)
.
The sun rises over Yellowstone National Park's famous Grand Prismatic Spring. "The sunrise light perfectly illuminates and accents this scene and colors," commented Your Shot producer David Y. Lee. The geological feature is the largest hot spring in the United States.
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod. #YourShotPhotographer

Road to Mt. Fuji | Photograph by Takashi (@takashi_artfuji)
.
“Mt. Fuji is on the three boundaries of Eurasia plate, North American plate, and Philippine Sea plate. Suruga Bay (in this photo) is very deep because the Philippine Sea plate sinks into the ocean floor,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Takashi. “An impressive expressway runs along the coast towards Mt. Fuji. The light of the cars extended by the long exposure makes for a beautiful spectacle at dawn.”
—
“I love it Takashi — I am so used to your photos of Mt. Fuji and this frame immediately caught my attention. Fantastic use of long exposure to take advantage of the colorful trails created by the car lights. I love that you shot this scene vertically, using the shape of the frame to help lead my eye with the roads to Mt. Fuji looming in the background. I love your Mt. Fuji series. I applaud your commitment. Well done.” — @natgeoyourshot Producer David Y. Lee (@davidylee)

Wild Wind | Photograph by Adam Gearing (@adamgearing)
.
“The wind had been harsh all day, with these low clouds moving across the mountain sporadically, blanketing the slopes,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Adam Gearing. “These grooves in the snow have been carved out by the winds, leaving a brilliant texture up the ridge-line.”
—
“I can feel the harsh wind blowing, this scene feels so cold, so miserable. And yet you composed yourself and took a really beautiful photo. I love how epic it feels. What an adventure. Very well done.” — @natgeoyourshot Producer David Y. Lee (@davidylee)

Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade | Photograph by Navid Baraty (@navidbaraty)
.
“This was my first time ever seeing the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day parade (in New York City) in person, and it was quite an unusual experience to see it from above,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Navid Baraty. “When you watch the parade on TV, the balloons appear to tower up into the buildings of Manhattan, but when viewed from high above, they feel so small and almost surreal as you watch the line of them float down 6th Avenue.”
—
“There is just something so cool about seeing this parade from above. It actually makes the balloons appear smaller in scale and this perspective looks like a model city. Great work capturing this moment from 30 stories up. It’s fascinating to study all the people below enjoying the parade.” — @natgeoyourshot Senior Producer Matt Adams (@themattadams)

Top Shot: Stripes on Stripes | Photograph by Yaron Schmid (@yswildlifephotography)
.
“During an early morning game drive in Etosha, Namibia, we stopped by Okaukuejo water hole,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Yaron Schmid. “This place is known for the large amount of animals that tend to visit it during the day. Unfortunately, only a lone zebra and a few Oryx were in the area. Luckily, this cautious zebra finally reached the water and started drinking as the first rays of the rising sun penetrated the morning clouds.” This image was selected for the Daily Dozen on November 19, 2018.
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account.

Ófærufoss Waterfall, Spring Portrait | Photograph by Andro Loria (@andro_loria)
.
“In 2017 I saw this beautiful waterfall from the ground and wanted to come back to take some aerials,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Andro Loria. “So, I did in spring. Or rather my great pilot friend, Haraldur Diego (@volcanopilot) surprised me by flying over without telling me in advance. It was hidden by the snow blanket, but a rainbow patch gave it away and the view was spectacular. The Ófærufoss Waterfall (approximately 120 meters in height) is on the Nyrðri-Ófæra river that flows into the great Eldgjá, or Canyon of Fire.”
—
“What an awesome surprise from your friend! This is a spectacular view — I love the inclusion of the snow, the patterns it creates in the aerial perspective works well with the other shapes and colors in this landscape.” — @natgeoyourshot Producer David Y. Lee (@davidylee)

Drifting | Photography by Abigail Fahey
.
#YourShotPhotographer Abigail Fahey's daughter floats in a swimming pool while her family vacations in Kyrenia, Cyprus. This bustling port city, located on the island's northern coast, is a popular tourist desintation.
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod. #YourShotPhotographer

Fall in Yosemite | Photograph by Hannah Mattner (@hannahmattner)
.
“Morning light along the Merced River in Yosemite Valley,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Hannah Mattner. “Fall colors and the stillness of the water created the most tranquil and vibrant experience.” This photo was selected for the November 23, 2018 edition of our Photos of the Week series.
—
“I never get sick of seeing Yosemite… I love the colors and late day autumn light throughout the frame. It feels peaceful and serene. Keep up the great work!” — @natgeoyourshot Associate Photo Editor Kristen McNicholas (@kemcnicholas)

Guatemala Dreams | Photograph by Eric J. Smith (@esmith_images)
.
#YourShotPhotographer Eric J. Smith traveled to rural Guatemala to see the incredible work of the Global Alliance for Clean Cookstoves. “The beautiful indigenous people near Sumpango allowed us into their lives,” writes Smith. “In all my travels, I have never encountered a more welcoming and accepting group of people. They left me profoundly moved and longing to return.”
—
“All the elements here work so well together. Great use of the overhead angle to show the young mother with child. My eye goes right from the mother to the sleeping baby and then studies the rest of the frame. Excellent work.” — @natgeo photographer Brian Skerry (@brianskerry)

Morning Light | Photograph by Sarmistha Bera (@sarmistha_bera)
.
#YourShotPhotographer Sarmistha Bera captured this morning scene in Kolkata, Bengal, India. This photo was selected for the November 16, 2018 edition of our Photos of the Week series.
—
“This is a lovely slice of life, Sarmistha! The light, especially the highlight on our character is completely stunning. I stopped in my tracks when I first saw it. I love the layers of laundry behind her, giving us a sense of place. Normally, I would advise against center weighted compositions because works so well because of how her highlight breaks through the negative space on the bottom half of the frame. Beautiful work!” — @natgeoyourshot Associate Photo Editor Kristen McNicholas (@kemcnicholas)

Flower Ring | Photograph by Radmila Trifunovic
.
“I was drinking my afternoon coffee in our backyard when my son brought me a flower from our garden,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Radmila Trifunovic. “While I was holding it, I snapped this shot through the glass table. I like the texture and red umbrella reflections.”
—
“This image is a beautiful combination of textures, colors, and shapes — with the elements both distorting and coming together.” — @natgeo photographer Diane Cook and Len Jenshel (@cookjenshel)

Driving Into the Clouds | Photograph by Manish Mamtani (@mmamtani)
.
“An aerial view of New Hampshire’s Kancamagus Highway after a rainy day with peak fall foliage,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Manish Mamtani. “I wait for the fall season all year. Sometimes there are bright colors and sometimes it is a dud due to weather. This year I saw some really beautiful colors in New England before it dried out due to the fluctuations in weather and a lot of rain and wind.”
—
“I love #YourShotPhotographer Stephanie Thomson’s comment: ‘The leading line of the road straight into the fog is stunning. I love how the vibrant colors seem to end at the fog as well; it’s as if I’m being taken into the unknown. Beautiful work Manish!” — @natgeoyourshot Producer David Y. Lee (@davidylee)

Sunset | Photograph bv Beth Mancuso (@bethjphotography)
.
#YourShotPhotographer Beth Mancuso took this photo at the Many Glacier in Glacier National Park in Montana. One of America’s most spectacular ecosystems, Glacier National Park encompasses nearly 1,600 square miles of snowcapped mountains, emerald-hued lakes, forests, and rivers.
This photo was selected for the November 16, 2018 edition of our Photos of the Week series.
—
“There is a really mysterious but delightful mood with the playful colors in the sky and the motion in the landscape. I love that you waited just after the sunset to see what the sky would do. Keep it up, Beth!” — @natgeoyourshot Associate Photo Editor Kristen McNicholas (@kemcnicholas)

Top Shot: Wildflowers at Lake Irwin | Photograph by Ben Strauss (@benstrauss_photography)
.
“Lake Irwin has got to be one of the prettiest campgrounds I’ve ever stayed at,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Ben Strauss. “This is especially true during wild flower season. This composition was taken near Irwin lodge from a spot I had scouted out the evening before, and overlooks the valley and lake seen below.” Lake Irwin is located roughly 9 miles from Crested Butte in the Rocky Mountains in Colorado, United States. This image was selected for the Daily Dozen on November 27, 2018.
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account.

Working Hard | Photograph by Zay Yar Lin (@zayyarlin84)
.
Two women work at a pottery in Twante, Myanmar. The township is famous for its pottery tradition and its clay wares are in high demand throughout the region. Many visitors to the capital city of Yangon will take a day trip out to this rural village for an opportunity to glimpse these craftspeople in action.
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod. #YourShotPhotographer

Fox and Ice | Photograph by Sonalini Khetrapal (@sonalinik)
.
"I wanted to photograph the rare blue morph species of arctic foxes in their harsh winter environment," says #YourShotPhotographer Sonalini Khetrapal. "To photograph these miraculously tough animals, I went to the uninhabited Hornstrandir Nature Reserve in northern Iceland. I captured my dream image as she stared straight at me, making fleeting eye contact, while we both braced ourselves against the roaring winds."
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod.

Red-fronted brown Lemur | Photograph by Anuroop Krishnan (@anuroof)
.
“On Madagascar, there are diverse habitats which are home to a number of lemur species,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Anuroop Krishnan. “The Red-fronted brown lemur is found in the southwestern part of the island, in its dry lowland forests. It feeds mostly on fruits, leaves and flowers, and often leaves the comfort of the trees to come down in search of seeds.” This photo was selected for the November 23, 2018 edition of our Photos of the Week series.
—
“Great work here, Anuroop! I love that we get a sense of this lemur’s inquisitive and curious nature. I feel like I could reach out and pet it. I love it!” — @natgeoyourshot Associate Photo Editor Kristen McNicholas (@kemcnicholas)

Elegant Swimmer | Photograph by Jacopo Fruchter (@jacopof_photography)
.
A mesmerizing octopus swims through some underwater rays of light. "The detail and incredible sharpness you managed to captured on the octopus's tentacles is so captivating!" commented #YourShotPhotographer Kimberly Coates (@kimcoatesphoto).
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod.

[ #TBT From November 22, 2016 ] Top Shot: The Other Side | Photograph by Pedro Londoño (@pedrografo)
.
#YourShotPhotographer Pedro Londoño found a great use for this window frame as he photographed a young boy swimming next to it. Londoño stood in the machine room of a public pool and waited for someone to swim by so he could capture this scene.
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account.

Top Shot: Sunlight Through the Smoke | Photograph by Kyle Miller (@wyoming_hotshots)
.
“A member of the Wyoming Hotshots uses a fuse, a flare that wildland firefighters carry to burnout out a short section of fire line,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Kyle Miller. “When there’s small fingers of unburned areas next to the fire line a common tactic is for firefighters to burn along the line so they can be there when the fire actively burns and is more prone to jump the containment line.” This image was selected for the Daily Dozen on November 23, 2018.
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account.

Schooling Jacks | Photograph by Samantha Schwann (@samanthaschwann)
.
“Cabo Pulmo is a small village located in between Cabo San Lucas and La Paz, Mexico,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Samantha Schwann. “In 1995, the residents petitioned the government to create a marine reserve to protect the area, which was being depleted by fishing operations and causing damage to the coral reef, estimated to be 20,000 years old. Since then, the biomass has seen an increase of nearly 450%, with a return of some species which hadn’t been seen since the 1980’s.”
—
“This scene is awesome. I love how they are making this turn in unison, my eye follows them to the dark spot where they are heading. I bet this was so amazing to witness in real life. Thanks for the detailed caption explaining the need to protect this area. Well done.” — @natgeoyourshot Producer David Y. Lee (@davidylee)

City Surfing | Photograph by Dalia Fichmann (@creativeartview)
.
“Night surfing session at the urban surf wave pool in Zurich during the beautiful sunset with surfer Martin Suter,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Dalia Fichmann. “In the background is the highest building in Switzerland: the Prime Tower. Martin Suter was born in a country without a sea, but is living his passion.”
—
“Wow, this looks like fun — to ride AND to watch. This is very cool, I love it Dalia. I agree with #YourShotPhotographer Yannick H. who commented, ‘Wow, I really like the lighting, with a great moment of the surfer! That’s what I call a nice city adventure!’ I shared your photo with a producer for @natgeoadventure Facebook page for their consideration. Just awesome. I love it.” — @natgeoyourshot Producer David Y. Lee (@davidylee)

The Three Peaks | Photograph by Eric Merideth (@eric_merideth)
.
The sun sets over the Tre Cime di Lavaredo, a well-known and distinctive mountain group in the Alps. Its name is Italian for the "three peaks of Lavaredo."
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod. #YourShotPhotographer

Medieval Dome | Photograph by Stefanos Politis (@steviewonderscapes)
.
Florence's famous cathedral, formally named Cattedrale di Santa Maria del Fiore in Italian, appears prominently in the city's skyline. The historic basilica—one of the largest churchs in all of Italy—began construction over seven centuries ago. "You can feel the aura from the medieval era," remarked #YourShotPhotographer Stefanos Politis.
—
Today we are featuring @natgeoyourshot photographs selected for @natgeo “Photo of the Day.” To see more, go to natgeo.com/pod.

Alpine Love | Photograph by Bruno Leveque (@bruno.leveque)
.
“So, this happened," writes #YourShotPhotographer Bruno Leveque. "We hiked close to 2000 meters of elevation to reach a beautiful spot I discovered a few months ago while preparing for our adventure in the Alps. I also hired my brother to make sure we caught a perfect photo of the moment. Everything went as I was expecting, we even pushed a storm away to get the perfect lighting condition. I diverted her attention on a fake distant lake, got on one knee, and waited until she looked back at me full of surprise… And she said Yes!”
—
“Congratulations Bruno. I love #YourShotPhotographer Robert Hergenrather (@flatfeet32)’s reaction: ‘I love the shot. It envokes courage. Because I’m sure you had thought, what a long hike down it would have been if she had said, ‘No.’ Fantastic work.” — @natgeoyourshot Producer David Y. Lee (@davidylee)

Top Shot: Dreaming Tiger | Photograph by Aman Wilson (@amanwilson)
.
A tiger sits and takes in its surroundings in Bandhavgarh, India. Your Shot Producer David Y. Lee writes, “Fantastic portrait of this tiger. I love how you did not just shoot the tiger staring into the camera — that would have been an easy snapshot. Instead, I love how you are using the landscape around it to reveal a sense of place which further elevates my interpretation behind its body language, as it stares off into the distance, watching something off-frame. This is beautiful Aman. Very well done.” This image was selected for the Daily Dozen on November 20, 2018.
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account.

[ #TBT From November 22, 2017 ] Top Shot: Between Two Worlds | Photograph by Jordan Robins (@jordan_robins)
.
“Whilst out snorkeling late one afternoon on Jervis Bay I stumbled across this Common Stingray gracefully gliding over the shallow sand flats,” writes #YourShotPhotographer Jordan Robins. “As the sun was setting, I managed to captured this over under image where you can see above and below the water captured in a single exposure.
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account.

[ #TBT From November 15, 2016 ] Top Shot: Staring Contest | Photograph by Michael Smith (@intothewildphotog)
.
#YourShotPhotographer Michael Smith got up close and personal with a young whale calf on a recent dive. “We had been observing this young calf in the waters off Vava'u, Tonga for perhaps 10 minutes when he decided to leave his mum’s side and swim over to get a closer look.,” said Smith. “Passing right in front of me I could clearly see his beautiful eye staring right into my soul.”
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account.

Top Shot: The Protection of Mama Bear | Photograph by Xavier Ortega (@xavierortega_wildlife)
.
A mother bear protects her cubs in Cabárceno Natural Park in Northern Spain. While the park is not a zoo, it does aim to conserve endangered species and increase environmental education. This image was selected for the Daily Dozen on November 26, 2018.
—
Top Shot features the photo with the most votes from the previous day’s Daily Dozen, 12 photos chosen by the Your Shot editors from thousands of recent uploads. Our community votes for their favorite photo from the selection, and the Top Shot is showcased on the @natgeoyourshot Instagram account. #YourShotPhotographer
